intro: Spermacoce tenuior, commonly known as smallleaf moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that split open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce tenuior is often found in open woodland and along forest edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
